results.title: Bilingual kids
results.creator_credit: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This program is designed to introduce teachers, parents and communities to the concept of bilingual education. It looks at processes involved in the implementation of the Greek:English Bilingual Pilot Project in the Richmond-Collingwood area. A number of evaluation findings are also discussed

results.title: Better life than them
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A group of 15 year olds are interviewed about their attitudes towards school, employment and unemployment and life expectations, peer group acceptance, short and long term prospects of jobs and careers.

results.title: International youth year
results.creator_credit: Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A discussion starter about problems and issues facing young people. Looks at cultural understanding and racism, technological change and consumerism, apprenticeship rights, single mothers, alcoholism and drug dependence, authority, nuclear disarmament, student participation, homelessness, disabled people and unemployment.

results.title: Human jigsaw
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Censored version. Presents a view of Odyssey House in Sydney and its drug rehabilitation program told by the residents undergoing treatment. Addresses the cynicism of many people to problems of addiction and cure. In particular the reasons for addiction are highlighted and shown not to be the easy of access to drugs but lack of emotional development within the individuals.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David E. Barrow, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: The Human face of Indonesia
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, David Roberts, John Darling, Rob McAuley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Consists of five programs that look at the lives of five very diverse people, each giving an insight into life in Indonesia today. Examines the trans-migration program, the plight of Java’s low income groups, the administrators of one of Indonesia’s poorest provinces and a Dalang man who is trying to keep alive his ancient Hindu religion where Islam is the official state religion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Haythornthwaite, David Roberts, John Darling, Rob McAuley and Film Australia

results.title: Life's a risky business
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions and Victorian Commercial Teachers' Association
results.brief_description: A humorous narrative that attempts to outline why insurance is essential and the different types available to individuals. Featuring Bruce Spence and Denise Drysdale.

results.title: Youth workers tapes
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Australia Open Chanel
results.brief_description: A series of six segments designed to estimulate discussion on various issues related to youth work. Four of the episodes contain dramatized situations depicting the difficulties faced by young people. Two of the episodes concentrate on the views of the youth workers in the field and youths who have been wards of he state.

results.title: A Very delicate matter (short version)
results.creator_credit: Claude Kerven, Patrick McCormick and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: A narrative which highlights the importance of honesty in sexual relationships where venereal disease is concerned. Stresses the responsibility to inform other sexual partners if one discovers one has the disease and indicates the possible consequences of the disease if it is left unchecked.

results.title: Supermarket
results.brief_description: A look at how a large independently owned supermarket is run. Although an American store is shown, the differences between its operation and that of an Australian supermarket are minor.

results.title: Middle East: journey into the future
results.brief_description: Depicts the dual life style of Taufic, an Egyptian farmer who, in order to support his family, must leave his village for two weeks in every four and work four hundred miles away as adviser for an oil company. Notes the stresses of the constant change of his life style and the necessity of the work to help the Middle East move into the future.
